radiographic_examinations.findings: The visualized lung bases are clear. Heart is slightly prominent in size. The liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal. The kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically. No renal or ureteral calculus was seen. Small bowel is normal in caliber. No upper abdominal free fluid or free air is seen. There is stranding and trace free fluid surrounding the mid to distal descending colon and involving the left paracolic gutter. The stranding continues to the proximal sigmoid colon. There are multiple diverticula throughout the sigmoid and descending colon. There may be a small 1.5 x 0.9 cm organizing fluid collection along the lateral descending colon vs an inflamed diverticulum. No free air or drainable fluid collection is seen. The appendix is normal. The bladder is unremarkable.
